Exaggerate: The claim suggests that two terrorists attacked the Ambaji temple, but it is later revealed that it was a mock drill organized by the police to test their readiness for the upcoming elections.
Lack enough support: The claim is based on a video posted by a Facebook page and some YouTube channels, without providing any additional evidence or sources to support the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video showing armed security personnel conducting an operation is evidence of a terrorist attack, without considering alternative explanations or verifying the authenticity of the video.
Exist alternative explanation: The police statement and news reports indicate that the incident was a mock drill organized by the police, not a terrorist attack.
Contradict fact: The official Facebook page of Ambaji temple and a fact-checking website (Boomlive) have debunked the narrative of a terrorist attack on the temple, contradicting the claim made in the video.
Falters at times: The claim falters in providing accurate information about the incident, as it presents a false narrative of a terrorist attack instead of the actual mock drill.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
